Overall as cliche as the story sounds, I'll still give it a six, not gonna lie but I actually enjoyed the series, if you try to get pass the flaws of the main character (which I still haven't, because I just dont like him lol) then its an alright anime to pass your time with.

Accel World. The dream of every anime-addicted gamer. With a story that revolves around a game that could affect your entire life, why wouldn't it be? Now let's move on. To provide you with a quick summary of the story, it revolves around Haruyuki, a fat, midget crybaby who always gets bullied. But then, he meets kuroyukihime, the beautiful student body president who is also actually a player of the game Brain burst. She then discovers Haruyuki's hidden talent at fast-based games, and so the story begins.
Story: the story is beautiful, although not perfect. As a anime based on the concepts of a game, ithas certain inconsistencies, like for example, in a normal match, your body can be torn into a million pieces, yet in the second match your body would be as good a new but for some reason, some characters never grew back their limbs.  Although such things are present, they aren’t that big of a deal that they could ruin the story. Now on to the good stuff. The good of the story is that it is clear and not confusing unlike other animes. It gives enough questions and cliffhangers to keep you interested and excited but not so much that the story turns into a complete mush. Overall i give it a 9/10.


Art : to put it simply, the animation was beautiful. The anime was wonderfully animated, giving a lot of detail to the character and the environment, which changes in almost every episode. But the thing that amazed me most is the amount of detail they put into the fight scenes. They put so much emphasis on the character's movements and techniques that it's difficult not to be amazed. Heck, i would even put it on par with the animation of angel beats, if not better. Overall i give it a 10/10 for being the one of the most visually stunning animes.


Sound: the voice acting was superb, being one of the best i've heard. The voicing was done just right; it conveys the emotions of the character without sounding exaggerated like naruto's annoying "sasuke" shouts although i do hate haru's whiny voice. Aside from that, the music is something. How do i say this? It's awesome enough that i could make it my ringtone and never get tired of listening to it. Overall i would give it a 10/10 for wonderful voice acting and a beautiful soundtrack.


Character: One thing I hate about Accel World is the characters. The story is beautiful, the art is beautiful, but the main character is so whiny, it’s not even funny. Another character, Takumu , is also very annoying. He’s acts like some self- loathing guy although he has already been forgiven for what he has done. There are probably more annoying characters in the story, but I won’t mention all of them. All I can say is that Accel world has a weak main character, which can make you facepalm from time to time. Overall I would give it a 7/10 because the characters are (mostly) whiny teenage highschool students who just cry when there are problems.


Enjoyment: I really enjoyed watching Accel world. For a person like me who loves a good adrenaline-inducing fight scene, then I would say that Accel world is a great anime. It also has those touching moments that can amaze you, but most of the time it just ends with Haru crying which totally kills the moment because he does it like every other episode. Overall i would give it an 8/10 i really love those fight scenes(or maybe because i'm just biased?).


Overall I give it an 8/10 for all the reasons mentioned above, and I do believe that I could’ve been higher, if it wasn’t for the weak main character. 


This is my first time writing a review and English is not my first language so I would gladly accept any criticism. Thanks for reading :))

Everything about the anime is likable except for the main character.  The art is pretty good, the music had me tearing up, and the story becomes increasingly favorable with its many intense action scenes and incredible twists and turns of the plot.  
I found the main character very difficult to relate to.  Haruyuki does however have very appropriate dialogue for his character and the plot leads to amazing character development for himself but mostly the other main characters.  He goes through quite the transformation from being the quiet, shy nerd who's always being bullied to the quite, shy nerd who hasa pretty epic avatar in a video-game... oh and also a really pretty girl by his side.

Kuroyukihime is the black snow princess.  Calm, elegant, and wise; she is very kuudere.  Her already seemingly invulnerable personality also goes through quite a change as she begins to open up to the other characters.

another good sci-fi anime that I ever watch, with a good combination in Story (that one of my fav anime theme "Game" involved) and Art & Sound. Accel World has a bunch battle scene and a bit harem.
I give a 9/10 scores for characters design, there's so much chara that I liked especially with the main heroine, and even supporting chara are really good, but too bad the main hero wasn't really close with my expectation (I bet that's what everyone thinks, and I always imagine his become someone else when I watch this entire show).
If you put aside that point like I do, thenyou'll find a good time to watch this anime, as I mentioned before, the battle scene of it will draw your intention.\n\n
And I think Accel World most interest point is because it somehow related to the other Game theme anime (I won't tell the title, but you should be know what is it)

Accel world is a brilliant anime with a lack of fillers and full of enjoyment.
The story is about junior high student, Arita Haruyuki, who meets a girl who's particularly interested in Arita, like nobody else is. She installs Brain Burst onto his Neuro Linker. Allowing him to access an alternative world; the "Accelerated World". With this story, comes their struggle to reach level 10, fight the kings of the six leagues and try not to lose all of their burst points.
But don't let this review give you the wrong idea. There's much more to the story than just that. If you ask me, watch it.Ever since I looked at this anime, I knew I wouldn't regret it. You won't either.

I remember watching the first episode of this anime and thinking how bizarre it is that the male lead isn't an attractive, tall character. To be honest I was a bit thrown off since I wasn't used to something like that after having watched so many other anime. I decided to give this anime a try after first watching Sword Art Online (henceforth referred to as S.A.O.), and I found that they both share a mutual concept - Virtual reality and online gaming. I watched the entire things through and sorta felt like this anime was better than S.A.O. It made me feel like S.A.O.was a bit of a disappointment especially since S.A.O. focused way too much on a love story than what most people were interested in (which was the MMORPG).\n\n
The art and soundtrack was very good which is something I really appreciate. The fact that the lead character was much different than your typical male lead kept me interested. I wanted to see how much the character would grow by the end of the series and I wasn't really disappointed. It explored a little more of the world of MMORPG than S.A.O., so it kept me entertained and interested.

Although it's clear that the man behind accel world wants to pass a message to bullied kids around the world (that they can be special) this is actually a very good anime. It's a bit over the edge in terms of emotions (mostly foolish ones due to the age of the characters) but it makes up with tons of effects and plenty of battles. A must see in my list.

Accel World...
It's ironic that in this Accel World, the fat ones are the ones who excels the most. I'm talking to Haruyuki, the biggest (literally) damn loser in his school. I personally believe that his character design must be changed? Why? His appearance is not suitable in the lovey dovey scenes with Kuriyukihime.. That's my honest opinion.. I think that Haruyuki's design must be the weak, fragile and the un-nutritious type of loser, not the healty loser..
On the other hand, I appreciated the way of Haruyuki being a loser. He is really bullied and disrespected. That is a good plot device and a good reasonwhy all of this Accel World stuff happened. The guy wants to be tall, to be thin, to have a good reputation, to be a perfect guy.. Who doesn't want that? 


Ok, here's a short introduction of the series.. Haruyuki is a big loser in the school. Then out of nowhere, I don't really get the logic, the school council president Kuruyukihime took an interest in him. Not that simple interest, also a loving interest.. (What the Hell) She gave the loser the program that can change his life, the Brain Burst.. And it really happened.. The loser became a champion... in the Accel World... So, here comes the challenger and the show begins!! FIGHT!!!


Like what I am doing.. Here are my thoughts..


Story

This is the story of underdogs.. No doubt.. It is the story how underdogs rise from the pits of hell to the top of the mountain.. This is the life struggle of Harayuki.. He is bullied, so he has low self esteem.. In the real life, he is a loser, but in the Accel World he can do unlimited possibilities.. The story also elaborates the concept of having Alter Egos.. You know, just like superheroes.. They are living normally in normal life but when danger arises they became different individuals.. This is also the same with this game.. Not only that, all armors embodied personal scars and trauma.. You can say that this series has an emotional direction mixed with awesome action scenes and sometimes off-the-hook love scenes..


I would like to comment on Haruyuki.. Like what I am implying.. He doens't need to be fat and short in order to be a super loser. There are still character designs that can match the character spirit.. But, I must admit.. the super loser factor is a key factor in order to insert the emotions in this series


I would like to thank everybody that this is not a pure harem anime or whatsoever because I will not really watch it.. Why? Because of Haruyuki..


Art 

This is good.. The artwork in the real world as well as the Accel World are good. In terms of the Accel World armors, the armors of the main characters are good. Haruyuki's armor is good.. The armor will look good with the shiny shimmering effects.. Though sometimes there are armors who are lacked of design or rather effects.. 


Sound

The sound is OK... 


Character

This is where things get interesting..


There are this times wherein I say "What the hell.. Why are you like that".. I will discuss why..


1) Haruyuki... Big losers act like big losers.. Well, he is crying and disappointed.. But the way he act and cry, he is like below 5 years old.. I mean I was like "AARRGH!! Stop it!!". And the way he is obsessed with Kuroyukihime, what the hell.. There are also times wherein he will have perverted thoughts about the girls he met, that was absolute "AAARGH!!" I don't know why, but I think I'm gonna blame it to his appearance.. He is like a maniac when he is in perverted mode (Pardon me).. But the catch is this, and I keep on telling this.. Maybe all of that character setup is to the sole purpose of injecting emotions in this series..


2) Chiyu.. What the hell is wrong with you? Who are you in love to? Haruyuki or Taku? (Mataku..) It is like she wants to do a two timing between the two guys.. I find it really "AAARGH!! What the hell.." Come on... Not only that, I found that I'm really annoyed on her tsundere like attitude.. Was that Tsundere?


3) Seiji Noumi.. This is the real villain type.. From the moment he entered the series, he shows the true meaning of evil.. He is bullying, creating mind games, doing dirty tricks, blackmailing.. From the moment he was introduced, I really want to punch him in the face and say "FU!!".. Wow, that is so good about this series.. I really hate the guy so much that when he was defeated I shouted "Yeah!! Die Motherf*****!!" To be honest, Seiji Noumi helped me watch the show and complete it overnight.. He is too damn annoying, which means he is a effective villain..


Well, there are the main points I noticed.. On some characters such as Kuruyukihime and Taku.. They are both fine.. The others were fine..


Enjoyment

Even though at times the characters are annoying, they are contributors in having a good series.. The super loser mode of Haruyuki is the main focus.. He is an underdog and I like underdogs who beat the hell out of those bossy class individuals such as Noumi.. The main enjoyment factor for me is when Noumi was defeated.. He is like very pathetic at the same time you will feel the loneliness because there are flashback that shows how he lost everything.. But I don't give a damn about the drama side of Noumi.. I really enjoyed the moment when he was defeated. It was the absolute victory.. Even I had an evil laugh when Noumi was defeated. It was refreshing.. Really..


Overall

Well, it is mixed emotion but I gave it a high mark because of the enjoyment factor.. The emotions are in the air.. Sometimes you feel the drama and sometimes you feel annoyed. But, one things for sure, you will experience annoyance but it is integral part of the story..


Well, that's my review of my first anime series that I finished with an MAL account that's why the ideas are so fresh.. Accel World is a good anime.. That's it


Thanks..


LightningSnow :)

There's such a difference in adaptation of material of author Reki Kawahara in Accel World versus Sword Art Online.
I watched Accel World after watching Sword Art Online, and I'm not exaggerating when I say that Sword Art Online gave me cancer. In fact, the World Health Organization should list that show as a carcinogen.
I would have rendered a score of 10 if this show's most glaring flaw wouldn't have happened, which is that there is no proper ending. There's a lot of plot threads that aren't tied up and that's because it abruptly ends after 2 arcs.
This show excels in character development. The characters aren'tubermensch that solve all problems. It's quite the opposite. A lot of them are horrible people that have problems of their own that they need to deal with.\n\n
The direction is also much better than the other series I mentioned. Instead of incomprehensible battles there are well animated sequences, good transitions, and logical extensions from scene to scene. The humor is also really good.\n\n
Hopefully, someday, the rest of this series gets adapted and it's as good as the rest.

Accel World is a pretty decent anime esp for MMO and VR fans , It has awesome opening and endings and the overall sounding is done really well , the visuals are good it's obvious that they have worked a lot on it , the battle scenes and the whole scenery , objects in them , the details you can see and everything else about them is well made .
There is the story next that some may complain about . Yes it's nothing flashy but at the same time it does engage the viewer and does surprise him at times getting him all excited espwhen it gets accompanied with beautiful scenes and good soundtrack but no matter how good it is you can say it's sth cliche and just go with that word afterall it's about a stupid fat kid that all girls like for no reason , always falls down then gets courage and rises up and every other crappy play you've seen before but it's kinda enjoyable most of the times . \n
The main issue with Accel World is it's characters . The protagonist is just unbearable it feels like you're just gonna throw up any moment . Both the design and sounding of the character are way below the level of the show you can easily see the particles in his face it's like they just got some cute slim design and then just dragged the sides and made him fat and chibi , not good chibi it just sucks they even made his avatar a round pig as if that figure in real life wasn't enough and you know what he says later in anime ? '' That he has gotten used to it '' actually i wanted to drop it at that moment , it is so much that it gets unbearable. Other characters are mostly well made although there are some that don't get much screen time and remain vague but those that do are actually touching .\n
I'm giving this an 8 but still there are better animes if you are into this genre .\n

If you thought Sword Art Online was bad, you'll think it's a complete masterpiece by the time you get through just one episode of Accel World. I watched the series almost 2 years ago but I've had this unfinished review sitting in my Gmail account all this time and I thought I'd do myself a favor by finally getting rid of it. Agree to disagree if you want.
I wrote pretty much wrote the entire review after I watched the series so I'm currently just revising what I wrote. The scathing harshness of my words drip like poison. This is basically a very long, salty rant.
TL;DR
Story(3/10) - Poor:

I wasn't all that surprised when I found out Accel World was done by the same author as SAO because the overall traits are the same. Advanced technology that can make fighting games feel like reality and a ton of generic cute girls all going for the main character. The only difference is that this main character is beyond unrealistic in terms of looks, has absolutely no backbone, and zero redeeming qualities. Also, apparently, losing one's privileges in a game is about the same as being executed in real life. Having privileges in said game gives you magic powers to control reality (or something.)

Overall, Accel World is full of complete nerds who want to escape reality. In all honesty, I don't feel that AW sends out the right "message" to the audience because it basically tells you that reality can be escaped, video games will solve all your problems and reality doesn't mean squat.


Art (8/10) - Very Good:

Despite Haruyuki's appearance, I must admit that AW's art is genuinely good. The colors are soft and the use of it is also not bad. Some of the fight scenes are really well choreographed and I found them interesting in a  lot of ways so, kudos in those regards.


Sound (7/10) - Good:

Attack on Titan called, they want Eren  Jaeger back. At some times, I could totally tell it was Kaji Yuuki voicing Haruyuki, at others, well.... He just sounded like a really whiny baby. In terms of voice acting, the AW's do as well as any other. Soundtrack is good, but I feel that sometimes the sound effects overrode the other sounds at certain points. It wasn't that the voice acting was poor, II'm just so bitter and spiteful that I can't even rate the easiest category the score it [might] deserve. 


Character (2/10) - Dreadful:

I've seen many a complex character in my day, but never have I come across one like Haruyuki. He's got absolutely zero charm, is a cry baby, a chibi, and obscenely obese. To top it off, he looks like a chibi piglet (just like his avatar) and I'm pretty sure even puberty can't solve his problems. The author of AW literally gives no break to Haruyuki's physical problems.Now then, if you can imagine all that, good. Now imagine the most "kawaii gorgeous beautiful" girl in an anime (at least according to this universe) actually having a crush on the character mentioned previously and getting jealous over him if one girl even sticks one toe towards his direction 

Now, it's not that Haruyuki is a crybaby that's a turn off or that he's shorter than a five year old or even that he's obese because it isn't really the looks that turns a person off to them (although it can be a major factor). It's the fact that he's all of this, makes no attempt to correct any of it, still gets the chicks and isn't even all that nice. This is the power of the harem genre, friends.

I will admit, he has shown a certain amount of "valor" but for what, a video game? True, I understand these "video games" are advanced enough to feel like reality, but no matter how real it may feel, it isn't and treating it as anything than such is beyond wrong. Now, I could understand how with Haruyuki's shortcomings he might want to escape reality but pretty much everyone else in the series has no excuse.


Enjoyment (1/10) - Pathetic:

I literally could not finish the series sooner. By the end of the season, I'd almost completely stopped paying attention and truth be told- I have no idea how it ended. Just that it did and I was praising /God/ that my brain cells were spared. 

I'm Agnostic, which means I don't even really believe in God. This is how grateful I was.


Overall (2/10) - Dreadul:

Don't get me wrong, I love my video games and I would totally support virtual reality if it existed, but AccelWorld takes things beyond what is realistically believable even in this universe. AW offers nothing new and is pretty much your average harem in a nutshell. I enjoyed SAO more than AW. 

This is literally the harshest review I've ever shared. Or, actually one of two.

But this is my personal best- worst review.

Oh boy, where to even start with this one..
I guess I should start with the good things first.
Animation is great, art style is viewer friendly, important scenes are very well animated, fights, specifically last one, are a join to watch and definitely the highlight of the whole series.
Sound is not very exceptional, but sound designers did a good job piecing together soundtrack that fits whole show quite well, especially improving in big fights or important moments. 
Story is exceptionally interesting and unique, at least from the perspective of sci-fi anime fan, but this is where good things end and bad things start.
Despite whole idea forthe show being very interesting indeed, the way the story is treated is just painful. Characters, specifically the main character Arita Haruyuki, is literally the worst protagonist of any anime series I've ever watched. Seriously, he is so ridiculously weak, clumsy and annoying it almost immediately killed my desire to watch this anime. \n
Even though he has few high points during the show, any and all possible sympathies towards him are brutally murdered by every single annoying thing he does. By the end of 2nd episode I started hating the main character more than I have ever hated any anime character ever, especially because Arita is probably the biggest crybaby and most helpless character in anime history.\n
Other characters actually improve the situation somewhat, especially the characters of Black Lotus,  Kuroyukihime , and Cyan Pile, Mayuzumi Takumu.\n
But they also could've been handled way better, but I guess can't ask much from anime watching which I was fantasizing about all the ways Arita could be killed off entirely for the rest of the series so he would never ever come back.\n
Characters and their story and interactions is actually what made me hate anime as a whole and delayed me completing this anime for like 2 weeks, which is unusual for me, as I normally watch 20-ish episode anime in one or two days max.\n
And here lies another problem. Characters are definitely the low point of this anime, but if you ignore them, the rest of the show is fine, with the problem being theres not much left. Characters are pretty much 70% of this show, and its bad, because Accel World could've easily been new Sidonia No Kishi or Neon Genesis Evangelion, if the characters were treated in different way. At this point it actually seems like this anime is directed strictly at 8 year old children or so, who only enjoy flashy colorful shows and don't care for the substance, because anyone who can think in long sentences probably will hate this anime as much as I did.\n
At most, this anime is good for one time viewing, as reviewing it for 2nd or even 3rd time most likely cause severe anger issues and might result in traumatized psyche of anyone who dares to attempt such foolishes.\n\n
TL:DR Quite pretty and well-stitched anime that is brutally killed by its characters. Watch only if you like great action scenes, but beware, the action in this anime takes maybe 10% of whole runtime.\n\n

Im not a huge fan of anime where the main character is a weak guy. I like anime were there is a strong main character that is a guy that protects others (mainly girls). That being said this anime was put together very well, having a weak main character that doesnt have much for confidence or self esteem really had me ticked off for the most part but through out the story he did get stronger and did work on his weaknesses which I thought was a little reassuring, however it wasnt enough for me to be satisfied... however Kuroyukihime made up for a lotof that, you didnt really see her in action for most of the anime but she was probably the only reason that Haruyuki Arita even bettered him self. She was the one who pushed him to improve himself which is something that i like just as much as a strong male lead. He pushed himself for her sake and improved upon himself almost every time because of it. as for the rest of the anime besides the two main characters, the story, art, sound, and characters were overall very good because they were well put together and they helped each category instead of getting in its way or even hurting it. (by that I mean they made each other category better then if one wasnt there to support it.) This is a good anime and I recommend it to anyone who likes anime were part of it is in real life and the other part is inside a game, with a hint of romance (this anime didnt really have to much, it almost seemed like they were best friends or really close rather then dating.)  and a little bit of having to figure things out in situations.

Im gonna try to keep this simple and explain why this show is potentially good.  
Story wise is pretty good. The author that made this also made SAO and I will tell you know they are completely different from each other. First half you have the MC ,Haru, trying to have a decent school like but gets bullied only to get introduced to a Augmented reality game called Brain Burst by a girl she likes.  
Also you think he would try to get her but he doesnt as he knows how much of a loser he is so keep that in mind. Asthey progress they they face with players trying to get rid of them as if you  have no points you lose the game forever.  

The story is simple but not like much other stories you would come across.  


The art is pretty simple with its bright colours to show off the augmented world and decent art style of character design. (besides Haru but I will get to that)


OP and ED Im not a fan of but the soundtrack isn't half bad.


Now this is where people stop watching. I dont know, Haru essentially looks really cartoony compared to the other characters and so a lot of people really dont like that. Now let me tell you. JUST GET OVER IT. GEES.   

I did dislike it but its not like Im gonna not watch it because of that. Just dont think so heavily about Haru's design and move on. Its literally so pathetic that so many people stopped watching it because of that.   

Moving on. The character development isnt so bad as well as you learn why they turn out the way they did. But are at least 3 I can think of that should really have more time to let us know who they are better.  


The action in this anime is pretty clean as there's no random ridiculous manouvers unless theres a reason or that its actually capable of doing. Where the story goes doesn't fail as there goal is clear within the game.   

The only thing I could complain about is that sometimes there are moments where it doesnt really seem logical of it happening but its not that big of a stain so you wont you dont need to worry over it.


Overall Whilst there are things that can be tweaked this anime is pretty good for its action, story and character development and I recommend you watch if you watched SAO as its set 20 years after that and is different compared to it.

this anime has to be one of the BEST things out right now. I was not totally sure at the beginning but each episode just brings you deeper and deeper in love with the story.
There is no pointless action. its all well thought out which is great. There is such thing as too much action and this show finds the perfect balance. I think some of the battle avatars could be as KICK ASS as black lotus but its still wonderful.
I love the kids mafia vibe that it gives around the virtual game and I know im glued until the very finish.
HIGHLY recommend to everyone

This anime is all about  a guy who gets into this battle game where you challenge people in real life, and the stakes are extremely high. He very quickly becomes one of the best players out there. Okay, so I'm sure that just about every other review out there gives you a much longer summary, but I'm going to skip to the actual review part, because that's what you're here for, right?
I thought that this was great anime, particularly for those of you who fell in love with SAO. (If you haven't watched SAO - THAT'S A CRIME - then I suggest you watchit before Accel World, because there are just some little things that would make more sense to you if you did.) The art was great and I actually didn't care at all that the protagonist doesn't have the traditional "hot guy" look. In fact, I don't really find him attractive at all, but that doesn't matter at all in this anime. He still gets the girl (not really a spoiler considering that he gets her within the first couple of episodes), and, I don't know, it just... doesn't matter. (Sorry for all you people who don't care whether or not the protagonist is attractive or not, just thought it was a point I should make.) 


The plot twists in this anime are things you may or may not be able to see coming. I know that when I watched it, I didn't see it coming, but I think that if I was watching a certain episode for the first time today, I would've guessed it. I think it just all depends on how much you really think about it, and how much you trust in certain characters.


Overall, I think the anime is a good one. The plot isn't the most amazing thing ever, but it's pretty darn good. The characters are awesome and you will most certainly come to love them. I would definitely suggest trying it out.

The story had a lot of potential, but it was a huge let down.  The first few episodes were amazing, and the way the world unfolded felt very natural and exciting.  I did not feel like I was in a class room being told exactly how this fantasy world operated.  That part was well done.
I felt the show's story took a huge turn for the worse, and left me feeling uninterested.  I only finished it for the sake of completion.

What might you remember about Accel World? Will it impact you? What I remember about Accel World is that Kuroyukihime was awesome as she was a capable character and a great main heroine. Haruyuki, our main man, has an extremely short stature was annoying and his stature was a cheap ploy to make him look less manly. Silver Crow's unique power has actually a well thought out and one would think it's a shame that this ability was wasted on Haruyuki. Unfortunately that isn't the case. As far as I remember, Haruyuki didn't ever have his power's full potential drawn out. The art and soundweren't memorable enough for a comment so they are neutral. Thus Accel World has great supporting characters and a lame hero with a cool power that could be used in a better way. Everything else was sub-par. You probably won't remember much about this series after watching it, so I only recommend watching it if a close friend or somebody you know has similar tastes recommends it. Otherwise, you're not missing out on much. My friends and I all watched it and it has never come up in conversation.

Okay. So I have to be honest with this. I don’t like mecha animes. Zoids, Transformers, Gundam; no. I really don’t like them. I didn’t want to watch this at first, but then I said: “Hey, maybe it’s time to watch something different.” I thought that if I didn’t like it, I could just type it down, and let others know that I didn’t like it. 
First off, the story goes like this: It’s Year 2046. Haruyuki “Haru” Arita is fed up with getting bullied because of his physicality. The effect of this: he has a low self-esteem. That is why he always logs onto the school’s local network, his only scapegoat. 


One day, he finds his highest score in Squash get beaten by Kuroyukihime, his upperclassman and Umesato Junior High School’s Student Council Vice-President, whom he has a crush on. Kuroyukihime, or Snow Black, invites him to lunch. There, they talk about the Brain Burst Program, which Haru eventually installs in his Neuro-Linker. But, not only did he find out that it is a virtual reality multiplayer online fighting game, but also, its point system, the Burst Points, can be converted into acceleration abilities in the real world.


Story: (9/10)

In creating stories involving the future, the possibilities are endless. But it still should be presented naturally. The Nero-Linker is a good example. You’ll definitely be thinking of saving some dough just to get this device from the store. I wish smart people would invent it now.


The story’s really good. It didn’t explore too much on the other kings (which were practically insignificant at the time), and focused only on Haru and the others. A big plus point? It would be Kuroyukihime’s feelings for Haru, which we rarely (or, not normally) see in the society. 


Art: (10/10)

Yes. Art. 10 points. I don’t think anybody will disagree with me on this.


Sound: (9/10)

Between the first and second opening, I’d say that Altima’s Burst The Gravity fits the show better. It has that vibe that unquestionably gave the second part of the series a revolutionary introduction.


Sachika Misawa’s Unite was good. It suited the second part of the series since it showed us Kuroyukihime’s point of view in some matters. Kotoko’s Unfinished, on the other hand, fitted the show much better. If you have heard it, you’ll know what I’m talking about.


The soundtrack overall is great. It has that futuristic feel that makes you want to turn up the volume while watching each scene (especially fight scenes).


Character: (9/10)

Though some characters were not developed well and were not dealt with properly, it was okay since Haru and Kuroyukihime were the most important pieces of the series. 


I love female protagonists who have black, long hair, and are cute and beautiful, which makes Kuroyukihime my most favourite character in the series. She’s really beautiful. And I love how she reacts sometimes when around Haru. She may have been a major contributor to why I loved the series.


Enjoyment: (10/10)

I have to say this again: I dislike mecha animes. But it’s fine now. Accel World gave me a change of heart. [Insert tears and sobbing]. 


Overall: (9/10)

I dislike mecha animes. Really. I genuinely thought I wouldn’t like it. I was wrong though. I have to say that I’m really hoping for a second season.


A great animation, unforgettable scenes, the developing love story of Haruyuki and Princess Snow Black, supplied with almost-perfect timing of gags, Altima and Kotoko’s opening and ending themes, little mysteries, and metal versus metal, Accel World may be one of the best mecha animes I’ve watched thus far. 


Oops.. Make that “the ONLY mecha anime I’ve watched so far”.

-may contain spoilers-
*sigh* Accel World, huh? 
Let's jut start, shall we?
Storyline: 3
The overall concept of the story is really interesting and could be SO much more, unfortunately the potential it has is only used in the last 3rd of the series. Other than that it is overly dramatic and especially in the first half of the series the characters act overly exaggerated, cry because of every little thing that comes along the way and that doesn't really change as the story comes along, except for that it makes more sense in the end, because the characters have lived through things together and learned to appreciatewhat they've been through and the relationships they've built. 


Art: 7

Kinda generic, but still enjoyable. Clean lines, nice colors, good concept art. The animations are nice to look at and the fighting scenes look great. Not much more that can be said here.


Sound: 7

I didn't really pay attention to the sound, I admit. I remember some decent backgroundmusic during the fights and some music to the underline pressure/excitement. The opening or ending themes didn't really stick with me, but I guess they're alright as well. As long as the music doesn't annoy me, it's fine. Same goes for the voice acting. The annoying drama of the plot is not something they're responsible for. 


Character: 3

Let's face it... the only character, who actually changes a little for decent REASONS is Haru. 

Sure, we have Taku, who also "changes", but that change is so sudden and exaggerated that it's not believable at all. Hime stays the same bossy tsundere throughout the whole series and Chiyu is still chasing for what she wished for in the beginning even in the end, the only difference is that later on she has new means to do something to make her wish come true. 

Now, let's come back to Haru. There are scenes where the game and the time he spent in it actually seems to have affected him in the real world, but in general he stays the same loser. A hero in the game, a loser in real life. Just like in the beginning. 

All the other characters are supposedly children of 14 years or younger, but act like adults. It would make sense, if they also acted as mature in the real world, but they don't. This is something that have been focused more on.


Enjoyment: 5

I did not enjoy the first half of the series... at all. The second half however finally drew out some of the consequences of the possible usage of the Brain Burst game that is also accessible in the real world. I mean, come on... you can slow down time and the only thing you do is playing a game? What a WASTE! Of course there would be much more people, who would use that power to their advantage in real life, especially if the only ones, who can use it are children and that should have been focused on, as well as on the mental state of the people, who stay for longer periods of time in the game world, where time goes by slower. Besides... the consequences of dying in the game that are known to Haru and the viewers are far too small to make such a fuss over not wanting to lose the game. 

Only in the very last episode one get's informed that you not only lose the possibility to play the game, but also the memories you acquired there. Why is everyone making such a big deal of losing the game if almost nobody knows that they'll lose their memories? I don't know. It's stupid. 


Overall: 6

As I said before, this show could be so much more. There is so much wasted potential and nothing to make up for the lack of it's usage. If someone would ask me to sum this anime up, I would say: "It's an anime about kids, who take a game way too seriously". Just like real MMO-addicts, only in a futuristic setting. 

Well, yes there is a weird romance going on which is not explained at all... like, really just like children. 

Anyhow, if you expect something from this anime, wait until Ep.16 or so, if not, don't bother watching.

Accel world has a great story, the  sound and character development was 
very good. I enjoyed this anime a lot, but I gave it a overall ranking of 
9/10 not a perfect 10/10 because, I dislike anime that leave you at a clip 
hanger, in this case they just ended it, at you expecting more... (No 
Spoilers), another thing I like about this anime is that the protagonist isn't 
some handsome tall and perfect guy but an average normal person with 
his own bad and good qualities.This anime is good for people who love 
tournament, fighting mixed with school and a bit of sci-fiand  comedy in \n\n
between, but overall this anime is great and I reccomend people to watch \n\n
this.

kaaaaaay so it's been a while since I watched this anime but it's okay cause 5 minutes ago I went on the wiki page and now i remember why I though this anime was ummm okayishkinda. Basically this anime is centered around some game that kids 15 and under play called brain burst. This is a game where you fight other people in order to steal their points. Now why would someone subject themselves to physical harm in order to play a crappy pokemon knock off, well the reason behind that is because they want to get these points so they can slow down timein order to achieve... stuff. 


Our main character. He was never hugged enough as a child and so he cries a lot. He is like this because that is what everyone looks for in a main character, since in anime there hasn't been enough annoying protagonists that bitch and whine. He is like if yuno wasn't bat-shit-crazy and expressed how broken she was by crying to everyone. Now this yuno's yuki is a skinny chick. She is the most popular girl in her school and she is into emotionally disturb children much like yuki and so wants to get into out main characters pants. However our main characters pants are simply to tight because of how obese he is and so she finds it very difficult to accomplish her task. There's also all that stuff with the brain's and the bursting but really it's just used to strengthen the superficial relationship's of all the main characters. Then there's the male best friend  and he is there because there has to be a smart person. Then there's the other female love interest and she is their because she has to be the other female love interest. As well we all know you cant have a full party without a tank and a healer. Then there are other characters


When it comes to this anime's story at first its generic romance with generic misconceptions and generic romancy stuff mixed in with generic shounen stuff about how he must be stronger and what not then later on it turns into a stupid  generic romance with generic misconceptions and generic romancy stuff mixed in with generic shounen stuff , however this anime makes a radical change by making all their characters look like there wearing fencing suits making them look like power ranger rejects. Then there's the fight's which are exact copies of the pokemon tv show's. There is also some stupid lvling up system. All in all the game aspects suck because its nothing like a game and really its more like an engine to create the stupidest deus ex scenario's  I've ever seen. Literally near the end they actually learn moves based of off will power alone. You know how hard it was to teach my ferrothorn rock spikes. YOU KNOW HOW MANY I HAD TO BREED AND YOUR TELLING ME THESE PEOPLE ARE LEARNING IT THROUGH WILL POWER NO ZERO POINTS GET OUT. all in all i give this anime a 10/10 in every section and recommend you go buy every single copy available ever.

Hhhmmm…to be honest here, I’m pretty disappointed with this movie. Like, really? The first half of the series was a recap of the series. wut?
Why?
WHY?
I don’t need any recap. I just wanted a sequel to the series.
And what do I get? 40 minutes of original content. Only 40 minutes. It felt like a 2-episode arc on a series. WTF man. If I had watched this on theatres, I might’ve rant so crazy.
Sigh.
After the recap, of course, I was expecting to be blown away by the main premise of the story but I got the opposite. True, I would admit the main story of the moviewas interesting, but it was wasted. It was too rush, and there was so many things going on I sometimes can’t even follow anymore. I also had so many many questions left unanswered. After the movie, I was dumbfounded, bruh.


It feels like there is a big big time gap between the series (as seen in the recap) and the main story of the movie. Like, why was the wheelchair girl regain her freakin’ legs?!?! That was totally random!! Who is this little shrine maiden girl?!?! Was there an untold alliance between the black & red faction?!?! What!?!?!? and many many more.


As a fan of the series (I haven’t read the light novel), this movie was a total disappointed. I cannot fathom how much I dislike watching this movie.


I think the only good thing I could compliment about this series was the art & animation. Well, its freakin’ Sunrise production movie, its always good. The fight scenes was visually appealing. That’s the only positive thing I could say.


Overall, this anime movie was a disappointment. I’m not really sure if this premise can be found in the light novels, if it is, this movie was then for the fans of the light novels and not much on the anime fans (like me T_T ).


I am still hoping for a proper sequel to the series.


Thanks for reading.


That is all.

There are no spoilers.
I was eager to watch this as it was one of those stories about a separate world, but I quickly realized how poor the story and characters are. The main character looks like Eric Cartman from South Park and while I have nothing against his apperance, the cover depicted him as some funny, sometimes angry fay guy. In reality he is a whiny, constantly crying and pathetic fatso. The way he is depicted as shorter than his peers is really annoying to me.
I, personally have no specific requirements for art or sound, but I care how good a story is, as wellhow enjoying it is, and this one has very mediocre story and the enjoyment wasn't big at all. The biggest compliment I can give to this show is that if I was 12-13 when I watched it, the chances of me enjoying it more (due to my underdeveloped tastes at the time) are higher.


Then the coolest girl in school that everyone admires instantly falls in love with him and even risks her life to protect him. Around that time I lost my patience and started skipping forward just to get rid of it.


Nothing really happened that piqued my attention, aside from the last villain who had particularly annoying personality and I honestly wanted him to get defeated. The show ends with a cliche happy ending and that's it.


If you like romance that makes no sense or unlikely heroes, you might enjoy this, for me those two aspects were forced to the point where the show became a pain to watch.

Long before I joined the anime community, I was just a short, nerdy, obese grade 7 student who only cares about video games and nothing more. That was the time when my name "Midget King" was found. Of course, I hung around people who matched my interests and personality, my so-called "followers". But not all of our classmates join in to this type of crowd so we were often bullied. We would play card games in every break or free time we can get. For a whole school year, that's what my life was about every single day of school. In the midst of thatschool year, I began to think that I should be doing something productive and that I should change myself because it felt that my life was taking a dive and it's getting harder to resurface. One of my friends then told me that even a fat midget can become popular and badass just like in one of the anime that he has seen. And that anime is Accel World. 


I don't know if that story is in any way relatable but that's one of the true stories in my life and I felt like I was reminded of that when I began watching this series. So... all those years and I just chose to watch it now. Maybe because I still have a lot of regret about that life I had during junior high. But now I can just laugh it off because I've gotten over it and without that situation, I can never be who I am today. Well... enough talking about me because I know you're here to read about the review I have prepared for Accel World. 


Accel World.. just a short-cut for "Accelerated World". When I first heard about it, I misinterpreted it as " Axel-World" instead so I thought it was an anime about racing. Well.. good thing I realized it sooner. When I read about the details to this series, I see that is very similar to Sword Art Online though this one was released sooner. Since I saw the latter one first, I couldn't help comparing both and somehow I thought that I should have seen Accel World first because I didn't enjoy the game-fantasy introduction that SAO did for the anime. Accel World was much more simpler in terms of game creativity. The story is somewhat unique and a bit common at the same time and the RPG elements are so-so. Since this was a series made for audience who just entered the world of anime, most of the story line was as I was expecting and the scenes are events not too uncommon from other related series. The first few episodes didn't really get me that much excited and I thought that nothing was too grand or astounding in this anime. The art was well done and I see that those backgrounds were well detailed for a futuristic timeline. And once again I thought about SAO on that platform. The anime being well illustrated and animated but the plot was not as exactly followed from the manga. The soundtrack is decent and the opening and ending themes give that action vibe that you are about to see in every episode. I loved the BGM especially the comic relief one. The characters are somehow strange but they were the typical types for these genres. What I didn't like about the characters is that they gave off the shounen aura and ambition that wasn't really supposed to be highlighted. Maybe that shouldn't really be a problem since the characters are still in the ages of middle-school. I hate weak-willed main characters so I was kinda thrown off by the MC here. I would appreciate it more if he had a bit more development throughout the plot. The main thing that I enjoyed about this anime are the fighting scenes. This anime is action packed in almost every episode so that might keep your boredom away. As weak-willed as the main character is, he has potential into becoming overpowered and he doesn't really disappoint that much. The ending was satisfying and it seemed that loose ends have come to connect but it feels that there is more work to be done and there should be a sequel to this series. We can't just cut it off at that arc. So I hope there would be a second season. Still, this series is very much recommended if you're new into anime or haven't seen SAO yet. This series is all about futuristic MMO's.


That was my review and my storytime for Accel World. If you want to ask some more questions, feel free to message me and I hope you have a good time watching.

NOTE: Although this review focuses mainly on the tv series, it covers the entire animated franchise up until this point. If you happen to be one of the few people that didn’t watch it, thought of giving it a chance, and are reading this right now, I should advise you that there are some spoilers here, so take this TL; DR instead: THIS FRANCHISE IS COMPLETE GARBAGE AND YOU SHOULDN’T WASTE YOUR TIME WITH IT.  With that said, let’s move to the review.
Ah, Accel World, the title that blew everyone’s mind when it came out for being about people playing videogames with an advancedvirtual reality technology, for featuring a fat ugly male protagonist and for being made by the author of Sword Art Online (this anime adaptation came out before SAO’s, but it was the other way around in the light novels). Since it panders to both the otaku and gamer audiences it was hailed as a masterpiece, and guess what, IT’S GARBAGE.


So the show presents this futuristic society where people basically get a wireless virtual world installed in their heads since they were born. They have access to internet whenever they feel like it and thus can mail and call other individuals, take notes and do their homework or search information virtually. All of which appears as windows in front of them which only they can see. It’s presented in the cheapest way possible with people moving their hands in front of thin air. 


They can also talk to others mentally if two or more people connect each other with a cable. This is also presented in the cheapest way possible with people sitting on a table and talking to each other without even moving their mouths. Good use of an advanced technology story presented in a visual medium there. Also sometimes their thoughts mix in and sometimes they don’t. Is there a rule which controls that? Nah, it changes whenever the author feels like throwing an ecchi joke or not. 


So it’s a society that wasted money and technology on an application that allows them to being anti-socials that don’t really communicate to each other but it’s really awesome because people can (not really) play crappy videogames from within. Yay!


Here’s some app called “Brain Burst” which transfers them to the “Accelerated World” that allows people to think way faster than the normal human brain but in order to do that they need some experience points and how does people gain said experience points? They play a crappy mmorpg and fighting game fusion which is obviously a serious and very dramatic thing.


The game already begins in a ridiculous way by basically raping the players’ mind to get information about them and create their avatars based on their emotions and psyche (mostly insecurities). Um, what? Why would someone do such a thing, why no one demanded the developer for being a potential cyber-terrorist group that brainwashes people? Who cares, let’s play videogames! And the designs are ridiculous, simple yet deformed robots with one or two colors and no explanations whatsoever about how that specific design reflects its player. 


What about the game itself? A generic mmo where people kill creeps and gain level; there isn’t even some lore behind the world they play in. They don’t even form factions because those were already formed when the game started by some people that apparently didn’t have better things to do than playing a bad videogame the whole time, said people didn’t even wanted to reach the finale of the game and instead tried to be at peace. What kind of gamers are those? But don’t worry because the main girl of the show didn’t like that and betrayed them and decapitated the guy that proposed that and since then there are factions at war in the game. 


What that means is that the little bit of story within the game was made by the players and no from the game itself, how sad is that for a game that is not about creating your stuff with whatever is given to you like some simulation game or Minecraft? (And even that game has some sort of story).


What about the leveling and abilities system and the gameplay? People gain experience by killing creeps or fighting against other players, just like in any other mmo. But since this is also an rpg they also unlock new abilities when they gain more level. How? Weren’t their personas based on each person? Why don’t they begin with all of their unique abilities if their avatars were created based on the individual characteristic of each one? Why are the character’s abilities so similar to the ones of generic rpg classes like mages or healers when they are supposed to be based on each individual? What about those abilities represents the players? Who cares let’s just play videogames! 


Just like in any other mmo, the players have a health bar, and while that should balance the battles, it doesn’t. What I mean is that they play a game, they have health bars, they battle with specific abilities that consumes specific amount of energy (they have some form of it in the game too) and deals a specific amount of damage. Yet the protagonist can be easily owned by whoever he encounters and is always about to lose, but when he has the lowest amount of health you can imagine, the same abilities that almost killed him (or new even more powerful) now deal nearly to no damage, what does that mean? It means that he has a ridiculous amount of plot armor. Oh, and he also can easily defeat his opponents in the end with just a few attacks, of course. And let’s not forget that he is able to do that because he has THE SUPER AMAZING, UNBELIEVABLE, UNIMAGINABLE AND UNMATCHABLE ABILITY OF… being able to fly, wow…


The players gain experience points whenever they kill shit or defeat other players, you know, basic stuff, and that’s a super important and dramatic thing because if they lose all of their points they lose in the game, and if they lose in the game, what could happen? Are whole races and kingdoms going to submit to others like in No Game no Life? No. Will the players lose their lives like in Sword Art Online? No. THE SUPER IMPORTANT, DRAMATIC AND SERIOUS THING THAT IS GOING TO HAPPEN IF THEY LOSE THE GAME IS…wait for it…that they won’t be able to play the game ever again. The system blocks their ID and thus it doesn’t allow the losers to play the game ever again. Those are some really high stakes, right? Also, what kind of mmorpg blocks its players permanently? One that doesn’t expect to stay afloat for much time, I guess. 


And the losers can’t even recommend the game to other people because the app instantly erases their memories of the game, and their time and role there. Do you need another proof that this developer is a potential cyber terrorist group? Say what you want about how games make people stupid, no game in real life (up until now) fucks up the players’ mind like this one, thankfully (well, maybe porn games, specially the vr ones that are being developed, oh God, what are we doing…). 


That’s what happens when you create a nonsensical futuristic society with an advanced virtual reality without any form of control. How do they deal with hacking in such a society?

Anyways the brainwash is done supposedly because the game must remain secret, yeah, because having people yelling BURST LINK every time they enter is not suspicious at all. 


Remember how experience points work? Well, forget about that, why? Remember when I said that the main girl of the show killed another player? Well, here’s what happened: she caught off guard the other player and instantly chopped off him. What happened with all the experience stuff? Well, turns out whenever two or more top players fight, they one-shot the other, taking away their whole experience and thus making they lose the game instantly. Why would such a broken rule which completely contradicts the mechanics of the game exist? Well, I guess it turns the game into something like Day Z and it becomes more interesting…if the protagonist didn’t have plot armor, that is.


You see, when Haruyuki, the protagonist, loses, he just gets his ultimate ability robbed by another player and becomes an unimportant player that slowly goes back to the top to fight against the asshole that defeated him once again, no big deal. 


Even in their real life the main characters have plot armor. In the early episodes of the show Kuroyukihime, the main girl, wants to help Haru with his bully, so she gets him being punched by that guy so the asshole gets expelled, and what does he does for a revenge? HE ATTEMPTS TO CRASH HARU WITH HIS CAR, OF COURSE. But do not worry, dear viewer, here’s Kuroyukihime to save the day. After a long, unbelievable, lame, melodramatic, hypocritical and selfish love confession, she uses a once in a long time unique ability only the top players can use and thinks even faster, and uses her avatar to move her real body, so she gets crashed by the car instead of Haru, and after a few days, she’s ok and playing the game again, of course. 

Let’s talk about the third arc of the series, because the other two were about people playing games where all those problems I already mentioned appear. So this particular arc is about how another student of their same school uses the app for something different than playing the game and that is cheating in the school exams so he gets better grades. It was refreshing to see something slightly different but the handling of this arc was also really bad. On one hand, it brings out an interesting question to the table, if we had and application like this, wouldn’t we abuse of it in order to get personal benefit? And wouldn’t we try our best to do that? Yet, again, the handling of this arc was terrible.


Leaving the fact of how minimal his main objective is aside, the antagonist of this arc is so edgy that you can’t take him seriously; he laughs as a maniac and treats everyone like shit because he gets better grades and because he has a higher score on a videogame. He does all that because he suffered bullying in the past from his brother, meaning he is not only edgy but also victimized; Haru went through something similar and he didn’t become a piece of shit. Also, he use one of Haru’s friends to gain points in the game, because she has THE SUPER AMAZING, UNBELIEVABLE, UNIMAGINABLE AND UNMATCHABLE ABILITY OF…being able to heal. What kind of lame ass mmorpg is this where a basic ability like that is a big deal?


This girl kept saying the whole series that everyone is stupid for taking a game so seriously and when an asshole tells her to betray her friends in order to gain more experience in a game she supposedly doesn’t care that much about she instantly agrees? Well Haru and this girl were extorted by the antagonist, yes, but it’s a futuristic society where they have all kind of stuff in their heads, they can record conversations and videos anytime they want. If it’s possible to do it today with no much difficulty, imagine how easy it should be for them, the whole arc could’ve been avoided. 


And what does the super pro player Kuroyukihime is doing? She is on a school trip until she appears at the ends of the arc and easily defeats their enemies except for the main bad guy who has to be faced by Haru, because otherwise he wouldn’t regain his ultimate ability I guess. And of course, the final fight is full of plot armor, ass-pulls, new abilities similar to others and lame motivational speeches, what did you expect, strategies and fair conditions for each player? Oh, silly you. 


This third arc ended up being the worst, not only has all the problems from previous ones such as plot armor and ass-pulls and could’ve been avoided as I stated before but it also contradicts the most basic rules of the series:


-Two players who have similar abilities to those of Haru and a girl from the second arc appear and Haru gets his ultimate robbed. How is it possible for his ability to get robbed by other player? How is it possible that there are players with similar abilities? Weren’t their abilities unique because they supposedly represent every player’s personality and psyche?

-During Kuroyukihime’s trip she has her own adventure fighting a random monster and she gets the help of her best friend, who was a Burst Linker before but she’s not anymore. It is stated at the beginning of the series that whenever someone loses the game and it’s uninstalled that person can’t play it again. What happened to that? Also this mini arc was thrown in during the last arc interrupting the story. I don’t care if it was a side story in the light novels or something like that, in the anime adaptation it killed the narrative flow just like a filler arc does. 


Now, let’s talk about the characters, shall we? Unlike most of the others modern anime’s protagonists, Haru is fat, short, ugly, suffered bullying and have an inferiority complex. So this isn’t a story about a bland self-insert Gary Stu that haves all the chicks for stupid reasons and an empowerment fantasy for otakus and is actually about an interesting, flawed and well developed protagonist? No, is the same shit as the others but even more retarded. Why? Because lots of girls fall in love with him despite all of his flaws because he is kind and good at videogames, featuring not one but two cliché and lame characteristics of modern anime’s protagonists in one package that no girl would see as enough of a reason to fall for a guy. 


To his credit, he gets some development throughout the story as he becomes stronger and thus he gains more self-confidence, but that is also inconsistent since he is constantly going back to how he was, and the circle repeats forever whenever something positive, immediately followed by something negative, happen to him. 


As for the other characters, there’s Kuroyukihime, the perfect waifu of the show that is somehow a pro player, a top student, and a kind hearted person at the same time, yet in reality she’s selfish and hypocrite. I can’t believe how every fan of this series takes her characterization at face value and don’t realize how she only wants Haru for his (not real) capabilities of taking her to the top of a freaking mmorpg. 


As for the others, edgy enemies with close to none characterization, and some turns out to be cliché harem archetypes that fall for Haru because of the aforementioned reasons; Takumu, a typical protagonist’s best friend, and Chiyuri, that bitch that isn’t just annoying and useless and not only betrays her friends for stupid reasons but is also jealous of Haru and Kuroyukihime and she tries to take advantage on him despite being his best friend’s girlfriend. Fuck this girl.


And that’s it for the series, although it has an interesting concept and some attempt at showing people’s change of attitude by the dependence of advance technology and less social interactions, as well as some attempt at showing how we would abuse of some power or facility gave to us if we have the chance to get benefits from it, along with some development for the main character, everything failed in the long run. Apart from the interesting premise, the only positive aspect regarding the story that I can think about is the pacing, which is not good, but not bad either. Take in count that while it’s still an adaptation with no ending, it covers three arcs where the protagonists fight against various other factions, which means that every important character was already revealed. But then again, this is also questionable because they keep making progress and going back to square one and then they constantly keep repeating the process. 


If there are some positive aspects in this show, those would be the visual and sound department, the character designs are generic, bland, and Haru and the avatars are ugly and retarded, and the voice acting is nothing special; but the backgrounds, the motions, and the special effects are well done, and the sound effects and soundtrack range from fine to good, making the world they play in and their fights spectacular on a superficial level. I don’t want to waste more time in this, I’m moving to the rest of the franchise.


The tv series was followed by two ovas that were silly ova material about a pumpkin hunting other players full of fan service, even more retarded designs and melodrama regarding the not couple from the show and another one about onsen, Haru being fat and having to lose some weight in order to pass a medical exam in school, what does this have to do with gaming? Well if he doesn’t lose weight he can’t play videogames for stupid reasons. That’s it, don’t lose weight to gain better health and appearance, do it so you can go back to play videogames for another person. Overall good pacing, visuals and sound apart, there’s nothing more to these ovas, moving on.


After that, another studio released some two minutes specials about every character being even more retarded, barely trying to hide their fetishes (Haru’s best friend is literally treated as a dog by his girlfriend in these specials) and, of course, everything is shown in a crappy chibi style. 


And finally, four years after the tv and ova series finished, Sunrise released a movie, and it’s easily the worst thing in the franchise. It tried, and failed, to be a recap movie, a sequel to the former entries, a stand-alone entry, and an adaptation of some volume of the light novel series to please the fans that were waiting for a second season, all at the same time. How is it possible to fail that hard? Well, like this: 


-Bad as a recap movie: It only covers part of the series, leaving some details from the show off the summary. 


-Bad as a sequel: The events here happen way after the tv and ova series, if it is watched by a person that never read the light novel series, said person would ask him/herself: Who are all of this new people? When and how did the long time characters gain so many new abilities? (Said abilities are pretty op btw) Why are the two factions still allies when they already accomplished their common objective in the series? Shouldn’t they go back to be enemies already since they want to reach glory (if you can call reaching the top of a mmo that) by their own? What are the new areas they go to? When and how Haru got rid of his curse?


-Bad as a stand-alone entry: You may think that this movie shouldn’t be judged as such because it doesn’t try to be one, but it is. Why would it include a recap then, if it wasn’t? The people that watched the series already knows the story, and the same goes for the people that kept reading the light novels, of course. Yet the movie starts with a recap that lasts for half its duration, and wastes said duration in stupid things instead of telling the viewer all of its important details. That aside, it’s also just a bullshit mission about two factions fighting against a feminine player that somehow allied with a monster in the game for escapists reasons, and she was defeated by the power of lame speech about love and friendship, and bullshit op new abilities. But that does not mean that the film can’t include some silly moments about the main (not) couple, right? Talk about wasting screen time in nothing.


-Bad as an adaptation: It is not even good as an adaptation of its source material because it changed some important details from the story it’s supposed to be adapting. 


Good animation and sound apart, this movie is a complete disaster, there is not a single good thing about its script and thus, it does not deserve more than the minimal score. 


And that’s it for the franchise, the tv series alone is slightly better but, as a whole, is the anime equivalent of the third Spy Kids film, and that’s definitely not a good thing.

Accel World has got to be one of the best anime I have seen yet, its art style, characters and action all have a great impact on dragging the viewer into the anime, I was shaking pretty much the whole way through from excitement and quite a few times, some really touching points.
Accel World steals your attention by messing with your emotions. In a good way. The amount of character development that the creators went through to improve the more lower characters is very pleasing.
While watching Accel World you should expect to have:

As well as those listed above, you could actually learn a few life lessons, which some people will shrug away but some are actually quite useful to know.\n\n
In all, I rate Accel world a 9. Everything is just so satisfying, I cannot wait for the movie to come out (Accel World: Infinite∞Burst)\n\n
