Thanks,\n
- Anthony.

Just finished this anime, and felt compelled to write a review on it. I feel very ambivalent about it. On one hand it has a great many good points, but on the other hand it also fails quite spectacularly at others. Disclaimer before I start, I haven't read any of the manga associated with this anime, and i did speed through some episodes in the middle.
Story:7
The story has its high and low points. First the high points. Initial premise regarding the accelerated world and it's workings was very intriguing and unique. I especially enjoyed the idea of it being able to support situations in thereal life as well. Game avatars were also a cool idea. Basically the main premise of the show was so mind-blowingly satisfying (coupled with the art, characters, etc.) that if it had ended earlier, i would have given it a 10. But, beyond the halfway mark of the anime, things took a turn downward. In fact, It could be more accurately described as a nosedive. I don't know why, but i strongly disliked this anime's plot after the first half, beginning with the introduction of Dusk Taker. It just seemed so contrary to the story's progression. And after that, it became very predictable and devolved into your generic game fighting anime. There were also strong undertones of bullying, so trigger warning there. I did not like it after that midpoint. But it was semi-redeemed at the end when we got to see the MC grow a pair and follow through (i would spoil the actual ending). It was very satisfying to watch an MC who follows through and doesn't have that sudden sense of compassion. So overall, two very polar opposites combined together gives it a middling rating for me. The first half was awesome, eye catching, and interesting, while the second half was mediocre, predictable, and overplayed. 


Art: 9

Well as expected of a newer anime, the art is top notch. Very consistent in style, quality, and color choice. Character designs (with the exception of the MC) were very well done, pleasing to the eye, and fit with the genre and setting well. Depictions of both the real and accelerated world were satisfactory, and the animation was crisp. Unfortunately, this anime has the curse of being watched by me after UBW, so it gets a 9, since 10 should only be given to F/SN UBW. But other than that, very well done in all aspects visually.


Sound:8

For the most part again, not too bad. Similar to the story aspect of this anime, it was pretty good. I enjoyed the first opening and ending songs. VAs were chosen well, not unfitting of the characters. In anime sound was also pretty good, nothing flashy and noticeable, but it blended well with the art and flow of the story. Overall not bad.


Character:6

Easily the weakest part of this anime. Lets get in depth here. First off the MC. As I mentioned before, his character design is not the best. I personally did not enjoy it, It felt out of place. Also, he is a crybaby who can't do anything on his own, and I quickly got annoyed with his repeated antics. Honestly as a whole, a very weak MC. Next, the MC's triage of friends; Taku, Chiyu, and Black Lotus. Out of the three, Taku is probably the best, he is levelheaded, strong, and responsible. But other than him, the rest of them are quite lacking. Chiyu presents the big-sister type who disregards the MC's games, but eventually gets sucked in as well. totally predictable. And the Black Lotus character is pretty much just so overpowered that she is just the be-all-end-all to all fights. If a fight gets too hard for the MC, count on BL to show up in the nick of time and save the day. And finally the other characters. Here's where my main beef with the characters are. Almost all of the characters in the story were a means to an end. What i mean by that is that they are perfectly designed to meet a certain need of the MC at the exact perfect time. And once that purpose is served, the disappear without much afterthought. And I dislike that. Its as if the writer brought these characters to existence just to  do one thing, and then disappear. And some of the situations surrounding them are so contrived that its so painfully obvious that a certain character has only one purpose, for the entire anime. 


Enjoyment:6

again, here its split into two parts. At the beginning and first half of it, I enjoyed it immensely. with the exception of the MC, the story was great, the art and sound were amazing, the premise of the story was refreshing, and the characters were flashy, cool, and with style. But after the halfway mark, the entire anime fell flat for me. From that point on, all the characters felt rushed, contrived, and very one dimensional. In addition, the story became painfully predictable, which when combined together made the second half of the anime hard to enjoy.


OVERALL: 7

Wavered between a 6 and a 7, and decided a 6 would be a bit too harsh. It had a great premise, a great cast and awesome sound/art, but that only lasted the first 12 episodes, and from then on, most of it was pretty underwhelming, especially when compared to the first half. And yea i kinda explained this in the section above, so there isn't much to elaborate on. So broken down, it'd probably be along the lines of 3 for art+ 2 for first half of story +1 for characters +1 for the ending = 7 overall

Accel World is yet another series that starts strong but fails to muster enough momentum to keep going. There are definitely some good points to this show but equally many, if not more, negative points. If anything, the series generates some serious feelings from viewers if the other reviews are an indication of anything.
So what is it? It's a futuristic setting where a computer is essentially connected to your brain through a neck bracelet, think of Google's Project Glass except the glasses are in your mind. This allows everyone constant connections to the web and, importantly, the ability to "dive" into a virtual world- verysimilar to the Matrix but with a much less painful wireless connection. Our protagonist, being a South Park derivative character, isn't worth much in the real world and so has become an expert in the virtual world. He is soon approached by what must be one of the only reasons why I'd recommend watching this show, Kurohime, who offers him a chance to take the red pill.


I'm fascinated by futuristic, technology-centric settings, and this is no exception. However, this show is plagued by cheap plot tricks, a protagonist who makes Yukiteru from Mirai Nikki look like a hero, and arcs that are painful to watch and take forever to finish. If you're into fantasy/futuristic-based shonen action series, then this might be fun. If you're looking for serious relationships or a mature, well-executed storyline, this is not for you. If your willing to put up with the above shortcomings, welcome to the Accelerated World.


Animation:

The animation quality in Accel World is quite good. Colors are vibrant, battles are fast paced, and effects are everywhere. This isn't your run-of-the-mill cheap animation. I was very impressed with the innovative heads-up UIs though still question why one still needs to use their hands if it's all in ones brain. Overall, the series does a great job in immersing the viewer in very interesting environments. As for character designs, I guess the series was trying to be unique with piggy but... man is he an eyesore. And the thought that Kurohime would choose the lard-ball over everyone else... it's really setting some weird expectations for guys. Luckily, there are a wide variety of female characters to satisfy all fetishes ranging from tsunderes to bookworms and from lolis to maids. Despite the overwhelming amount of supporting characters, all the "important" ones are distinguishable.


As for battles, the majority of them take place in the virtual world so "pain" is felt though we are spared blood (though amputations, beheadings, etc. of metal frames is very common- think FMA). There are a lot of special moves and abilities so expect some pretty cool graphics. Choreography is good but not brilliant, ecchi is vaguely present though (luckily) not a key trait.


Sound:

Accel World uses some pretty nice electronic-based songs for the OP/EDs (including big names such as Kotoko and Altima (SNS Final anyone?). The BGM likewise follows this theme with some electronic themes as well; there are some gems hidden between the other more-forgettable tracks.


As for VA cast, I'm honestly surprised the protagonist of DxD could sound like such a wimp so I guess props to Yuuki Kaji for doing too good of a job. There are some pretty big names voicing some of the supporting roles but the real star is Sachika Misawa. If you haven't read her profile yet I recommend you do, she has amazing talent given her age.


Story:

Accel World has a pretty intricate story with a lot of details, you won't really fully understand the setting until you've finished half a dozen episodes. However, do be aware that this is not a finished product, while many plot elements are introduced many are not resolved. Yes, like Hagure this is another case of "wait till season 2 to find out".


However, Accel World does do a slightly better job of entertaining through the season. It starts out as a chaotic mess as Piggy's reality is completely turned upside down. Unfortunately, as things unravel, the series loses its pacing and decides to throw in random twists and inexplicable situations to keep the viewers interested (these fail miserably). This unfortunate turn is capped by a final arc so sour and off-putting that I really almost stopped watching. While there is a resolution, it is by no means satisfactory.


They really had a chance to make this one great, but unfortunately they did not deliver. Your only hope is to enjoy Kurohime. Hopefully we'll have better luck with Sword Art Online (by the same author).


Character:

This is a hard one as this series has some of the best characters I've seen a while, and a handful of the worst characters I've ever seen. Kurohime and the short but blissful appearances of Fuuko work magically to cancel out some of the tragically weak characters. Perhaps it's because these are really the only mature characters in an entire show filled with illogical, childish characters who hold on to pointlessly stupid ideologies. Really, if Japan continues to promote characters like Haruyuki... their youth really are doomed.


As for development, there really isn't much as relationships are quickly established early in the series- and nothing much changes from that point on. I believe there's some point to the Brain Burst program, but no one will truly understand why until the next season. Until then, it's anyone's guess.


Value:

This show truly had some unique ideas (who wouldn't want superhero-like reflexes?), some of which break all know laws of physics; but those aside it's an intriguing watch that raises philosophical questions. Unfortunately, my thinking highs are almost always interrupted by the throbbing sense that everyone other than Kurohime is an absolute idiot. While some aspects of the show are truly memorable and interesting, there are others that I would rather never see again. Accel World is an interesting concept that ultimately fell victim to a fat piggy and poor execution. Here's to hoping for a better season two.

The world of 2046 as portrayed in Accel World is perhaps the most realistic and well thought out version of the future I have ever seen. This is because it is centered around one world-changing invention: the Neuro Linker. The Neuro Linker is a personal computer that clips to your neck and overlays the computer screen over your field of vision. With it you can search the net, play online games, and call other people directly—talking virtual avatar to virtual avatar. Nearly from birth, everyone has one of these computers and it affects the very social structure of the world. Talking avatar to avatar isconsidered a common method of communication. On the other hand, cabling—i.e. connecting Neuro Linker to Neuro Linker directly with someone else sans the avatars—is considered one of the most intimate of actions as you not only talk mind to mind but also can access the other person's computer. It is the deep examination of the cultural impact of such a computer that makes Accel World so enjoyable.

Plot: Set in 2046, Young Haruyuki Arita "Haru" who is a short chubby junior high student is the primary target for bullies. With his miserable life (in the real world), he blows off steam playing games on the virtual reality and is ridiculously good at it. People have access to this virtual world (kinda like the internet) with the help of a device called Neuro-Linker , everyone has it installed in their necks. Despite being a loner and bully magnet, Arita still has his childhood friends supporting and trying to cheer him up, Chiyuri Kurashima "Chiyu", (She is an annoying character who can't decided betweenhis boyfriend and our MC Arita) and Takumu Mayuzumi "Taku" (Chiyu's boyfriend)


Kuroyukihime a.ka. Princess Black Snow (Her fascination with Haru will eventually become affection as the story progresses) the popular Student Council Vice Pres. of the same school, discovers Haruyuki's amazing talent in the virtual world and eventually gives him a program called "Brain Burst" w/c gives him access to the "Accelerated World". Now "Burst Linkers" (People who had installed Brain Burst) whenever they choose can accelerate their thought process a thousand times faster than normal people. Meaning a second in the real world is like a thousand seconds for them, making everything around them stop. Haru however will unexpectedly discover that the Brain Burst program, beneath it shell ,is a multiplayer fighting game. He gains a humanoid avatar called silver crow. The plot revolves around him fighting fellow brain bursters (with the guidance and inspiration of kuroyukihime) and climbing up and eventually "flying up" (he'll eventually have access to a skill that is unique to the Accelerated World) to the top of the ladder. A lot is going on with the plot, issues with side characters "Taku", "Chiyu" and the enigma "Kuroyukohime" will keep you busy and entertained. (More Side characters will be introduced as the plot progress).There will be ups and downs for Haru as he tries to evolve from sore loser to be the best at what he does with the help of his friends.


Review: The show offers a lot of entertainment, the fighting scenes are good and well-thought-of and there are a lot of characters (though a lot will annoy you w/c is a good thing for villains but bad for side characters). Viewers will be amazed by the well made virtual world that is the "Accelerated World" with all its rules and politics. Character designs are well made, the human counter parts are good but the android looking avatars are really great, colorful and well designed. The plot may sometimes be too shallow or not serious but it is expected from a "shounen" anime and it doesn't really affect the enjoyment that the show brings. It's mild and easy to watch and at the same time has good depth without being too analytic in its plot. If you want a good action shounen with logically well made plot this one is for you. 



My Personal Rating: 8/10 Nothing outstanding but will rarely bore you.

The year is 2046. Haruyuki Arita is a young boy who finds himself on the lowest social rungs of his school. Ashamed of his miserable life, Haruyuki can only cope by indulging in virtual games. But that all changes when Kuroyukihime, the most popular girl in school, introduces him to a mysterious program called Brain Burst and a virtual reality called the Accel World.
The first half of the anime was really exciting. The incorporation of the RPG element enhanced the genre and made the anime more interesting. 
The second half of the anime actually never mentions any of the established plot points in the firsthalf and introduced a new one. Haruyuki was made to look very weak despite his progress in the first half just to accommodate the length of the second half. 


The fight scenes are really great. The anime utilizes shaky camera techniques to amplify the scenes. They use different angles on most of them like when Haruyuki is flying or when a bunch of missile rockets scatter in the air makes the scenes more exciting  The fight scenes themselves are pretty straight forward but it is used to enhance the story as well. The anime is pretty smart in doing the storytelling in the fights which makes them a lot more exciting.


Overall it is pretty good. It’s a satisfying anime with all the fixing and it captured the world of MMORPG pretty spot on. The fight scenes are exciting and there is much to enjoy in this anime. I recommend it.

Story
The story of Accel World is pretty good. The story is pretty simple, and easy to follow, but remains engaging throughout, putting in quite a few twists and turns that makes you want to keep watching. However, in my opinion, has a major flaw. There are pretty much no stakes in the story at all. It takes the weight out of a lot of the fights when you realise that there isn't really anything to loose. However, in the last episode, after the last battle, they reveal something that would have made people a lot more invested in the story, and I think that itshould have been revealed earlier. 


Art

I really like the art style in this anime. It is full of an array of different colours due to it's varied environments throughout the show. This gives the show a lot of visual variety, and makes it stand out. The designs of the Battle Avatars are also pretty good for the most part, but a lot of the female battle avatars start to look a little too similar to each other. The general character designs for the show are also good,  looking quite a lot different from other shows I have seen. 


Sound

The sound is pretty good. The background music always fits the scene, but none of it is very memorable, outside of the second OP, which I thought was pretty good. The voice acting (English dub) was also just pretty good. Nothing really outstanding, but above average. 


Character

The characters in this show are the main reason to keep watching, in my opinion. As I mentioned previously, the story in just pretty good, so it needed great characters, and that was the main draw for me. Sure, the characters are mostly different traditional archetypes, the nerd, the bully, etc, but they are really likeable, and I felt myself really rooting for them throughout the show. One early episode in particular really got me on an emotional level, because I was really starting to love the characters in this show. My only issue with this part of the anime is that around the second half of the anime, one of the characters does a massive 180 and it really hurts your view of the character. They do justify it at the end, but it's a really weak, but plausible, excuse, and I feel the character had already been kind of ruined at that point.


Enjoyment

I really enjoyed this anime, despite it having some faults, and only a slightly above average story, mostly due to it's characters. The action scenes are really well done, and thoroughly entertaining due to the various abilities that are seen throughout the show, and you can really get into the characters' and their relationships. 


Overall: 8

Did I mention Accel World was written by Reki Kawahara, the same person who wrote Sword Art Online? People are going to instantly turned off to this anime because of this BUT HEAR ME OUT! This anime exceeds SAO. As somebody who despises SAO, I loved Accel World. I suggest people check this anime out.

***Please take note that the  spoilers do not state anything major, and I find them to support my point even more, so please consider reading them***
Now, before you guys start bringing out your pitchforks and start calling me names, hear me out. I know what feeling you get when you first read the summary, and see the first few minutes of the anime. You're probably thinking, "Is this really the protagonist of the story?" Now, I'll explain why this is actually not a bad idea for an anime, and it shouldn't be the only reason why the anime should be consider bad. However, Ishould first go over why this anime is amazing.


Story(9.0):


This story's premise is pretty generic, a new video game that comes out and changes a loser's life. Now most people would probably be thinking that its cheesy. However, I believe if you were to watch the first five episodes of the anime, you will be hooked. 


I love how the protagonist of the story is literally a fat loser. Why? Because it gives me a breathe of fresh air. Like most animes you see today contain characters that are simply OP and have very few flaws. I'm looking at you SAO. Also, the anime is taken place in the future, which I thought the writer who made this anime did really well to support this premise. I, mean, seriously, the story is taken place roughly 30 years from now, and humans thrive through technology, but not so futuristic that characters are living in mars (as far as I know). This gives the story realism through their own world. 


To add, the story gives out unanticipated plot twists as you watch the anime. This gives the anime a layer of suspense on what might happen during a fight scene. How will the protagonist overcome this strive? Will he lose? 


However, this anime's story does contain some flaws. For example, there are some parts that are unexplained in the anime, and sometimes, I find the duel system is little silly.(MINOR SPOILERS INCOMING NOTE) In Accel World, the players of the game, Brain Burst, have a dueling system in which you can fight players that are in the same network as you. This is stupid because what is to say that someone attempts to duel you forever? Then they will be stuck in time for eternity. There was no time limit explained in the anime (SPOILERS FINISHED)


Art (9.5)


I have to say that the drawing portion didn't have anything that stood out especially. I do like their art style, however, mainly because of the great uses of background and color. Everything in the drawings seems balanced, however, there are times in which I question the drawing. Like when the protagonist's eyes look like freaking basketballs. The animation, on the other hand, is simply stunning. The animation for the fight scenes are flashy, intense, and really great. 


Sound(10.0)


This is completely my opinion, but you might not have my taste in music. I really like both openings of the anime. They both give me emotions as if the protagonist can overcome the challenges he faces in the anime. Its as if you can do anything if you try hard enough. Sorry if that sounds corny to you.


Not only that, but the soundtrack is well-done as well. There might not be a lot of soundtracks for you to listen, but I'd prefer songs that I can recognize and know the mood of the scene rather than some mysterious soundtrack that was lazily done.


Characters(9.5)


I guess this is gonna be my longest section for my review. The anime introduces quite a small cast of characters, but they all of their own unique traits. Most of the characters of the story are definitely likable, and sometimes even cryptic. However, most of the characters explain their backgrounds in a few short minutes, and this seems very rushed. I thought that the anime would be better done if the characters were to go a little bit more in depth.


Now, I'll now explain the main protagonist of the story. Now, now, most people turn down this anime because of the pathetic little protagonist of the storyline. Now before you. A year ago, when I knew little about anime, and watched English dubbed because I never knew about subs, I decided to watch Accel World. My first impression of it was that the protagonist was pathetic, and I couldn't bear to watch him get punished. Instantly, I clicked away from the anime. 


Fast-forward to the present time, and I finished the entire anime within two days. I have to say, I still dislike the main character, and thought the story would be even better if the protagonist wasn't so bad. Nonetheless, this character does contribute a lot to the anime, and many scenes wouldn't had happened without him. Many vital scenes of the storyline wouldn't even had happened if it wasn't for this pathetic little character. This gives the watcher the idea that this little midget is actually the most important piece of what I call an astounding anime! There shouldn't be rants about how this anime sucks because of a weak MC, rather there should be MORE animes about these types of protagonists. Seriously, the story wouldn't be as good if Kirito was the main character, now would it?


Enjoyment(10.0)


As stated before, I watched the anime in two days (no life), so its probably gonna be enjoyable to take up so much time in so few days. I thought the anime was well-paced, and three arcs for a season just just right. I really thought I made the right choice to watch this anime once more ever since my first encounter with it.


Overall(10.0 or rather 9.75)


Now, this anime definitely has some flaws that deprive it from a perfect score, but I still think it deserves some more praise. Little things such as an unnecessary tutorial explanation or lack of death sentence is a bit harsh to call it a bad anime, wouldn't it? (MEDIUM LEVELED SPOILERS INCOMING) And to be honest, the ability to lose the game and memories of it actually suits the MC as the relationships he makes because of the game. Making the threat of losing those relationships would be pretty scary, as well. (MEDIUM LEVELED SPOILERS OVER). Overall, this anime dope slaps you hard if you stick around for even two episodes.

Accel world is an anime somewhat similar to its predecessor, Sword art online
Our protagonist also has a harem, is a chubby named haru (I'm not against it, do not judge people to be or not). Kuroyukihime is a character tsundere and somewhat interesting
The game called Accel world tries to fight until it reaches level 10 to meet the creator, although it is not known what happens later. People like the kings, who decided to make a peace treaty (All lvl 9) to avoid That happens in case the game ends or your memories are erased when losing, thus, keeping the fun and happiness of theplayers\n\n
The protagonists (Haru, Kuroyukihime, Chiyu, Taku) have a somewhat selfish and evil desire, reach level 10 to discover why everything, but, the issue is that they are so focused on their goal and their lives Like the constant worry of losing their memory), but they do not see that they ruin the fun and the ppaz of the world, by advancing with their plans, other problems occur that threaten both them and the kings. Over time, they admire The game a little more, sometimes giving doubts about whether to complete it or not, which gives them that "magic" touch to the story so to speak, but do not take their desires out of the way, over time more and more people are Joins the legion, increasing the number of problems\n\n
The same mistakes would be: The fan service, the useless harem, and sometimes the hacks kirito touches (Now in Haru)\n
Its good points would be: The small increase of development of the history or the evolution of the personages in themselves, the good drawing, the music\n
The bad ones: The desire of the protagonists causing that they are like the bad ones of the game

Story: 4
The Bad: I would have appreciated some more backstory on the main characters. There was no climax and resolution for the relationship match-ups. I expected one character to make a return and she never did. I felt there was an incomplete story in regard to the cursed armor. The goal that the characters wanted to reach wasn't achieved by the end. One-hit kills are boring. Kuroyukihime hardly did anything the second half of the anime.
The Good: Neuro linkers are cool; I want one. The idea of how the fighting avatars were created was neat. The powers the game gives you in the real-world arecool. Watching the formation of alliances and enemies was entertaining. Noumi really pissed me off, but then I couldn't hate him because of his story.


Art: 6


The Bad: Haru's real-world appearance shouldn't have been permanent. I like chibi-sized people for funny scenes only. Why be a pig when you can be anything else??? I wasn't fond of Kurashima's or Niko's fighters.


The Good: The different landscapes were nice; I like how they were related to the real world. Kuroyukihime's fighter and avatar were nice. Ash Roller, thumbs up. The futuristic neuro linker visuals were nice.


Sound: 6


This is my least favorite part of reviews. Unless I'm watching a music-based anime or the soundtrack is really good/bad, I usually give this a 6 and move on.


Character: 7


The Bad: Haru cries a lot. Kurashima is indecisive. Some side characters only last 1-2 episodes. Megumi is an enigma. I wanted to know Kuriyukihime's real name.


The Good: Haru can be a jerk because he's so depressed and has low self-esteem; I understand that. Taku is not indecisive. I like Taku better than Haru. When trying to right his wrongs, Taku learns to not spite himself. Kuroyukihime gets jealous. I got a good laugh from Niko's personality.


Enjoyment: 6


The anime held my interest long enough for me to watch all 24 episodes and 2 OVA in two days, so it wasn't bad. Still, I've seen better, but I've also seen worse. I probably won't watch this again because I hate stories that feel unfinished.


Overall: 6

Accel World gave me mixed feelings once I had finished watching it. I enjoyed the beginning, but not the end. The beginning seemed to be suggesting that there was going to be a very interesting ending to this series. It was fun to watch. But by the end it was bland and like whoever had created the plot had changed their mind at the last minute. I also liked the art-style of this anime, none of it looked particularly bad or lazily done. The characters were somewhat decent, too. I didn't really find them particularly annoying, I honestly think it was just the unimaginative endingthat ruined it.

I'll make this kinda short and simple. 
Story (5/10): Not bad. I really did like the concept in the beginning with all the acceleration and everything, but where the actual story ended up was pretty bad. The main character made this even worse. After the first half of the series, I had to force myself to finish the series because I wanted to see if it gets any better and because I didn't want to be biased and rate this without even completing the anime. 
Art (9/10): I like it. It's flashy and also has really well done moments with the dark atmosphere.
Sound (9/10): Well...no complaints here.\n\n
Character (1/10): I actually didn't want to watch this anime because the main character's appearance was so lame, but a friend told me to try it out. Back then I thought, "I guess I shouldn't judge a book by it's covers before actually trying it out." Now I think to myself, "Why did I listen to my friend? Is he even my friend?" Anyways, time to rate the characters: Literally trash. I thought the main character from Mirai Nikki was useless, but then I see this... The main character makes everything so infuriating. The fact is, he is a loser... however, because of this I was expecting improvement or something at least, but this character just makes dumb mistakes, does dumb things, and pisses me off while doing it. There are a lot of characters that are losers who improve such as the main character from Boku no Hero Academia. I assure you, Deku is like 100x better than Haruyuki. Haruyuki just doesn't change. He just stays like the weak little chibi he is and never improves. I have literally nothing good to say about the main character, but Chiyuri became much more frustrating near the end of the series. I won't spoil anything, but wow... never thought there would be a day where I'd hate someone more than Haruyuki. The only "good" character was Kuroyukihime because of her calm and collected personality. She never really does anything that is infuriating or idiotic which is really nice. Well, since I have nothing better to say, I'm just going to end my rant here. I think you get the idea of how I personally think about the characters. \n\n
Enjoyment (2/10): Well, considering the ratings so far, I really doubt I enjoyed it.\n\n
Overall (5/10): I did give it a 5 because I'm somewhat of an easy grader, but if I was forced to watch it again, I'd rather watch Boku no Pico. Honestly, I actually enjoyed SAO unlike many other people, so since this was by the same creator, I expected at least something good to come out of this series. All I actually got was anger and rage.

This Anime is very similar to SAO but different in the fact that the MC isn't quite what you would expect the MC or Hero to look like at all, but I think in my opinion that's what sets it apart from every other Anime out there.
Story
The story line of Accel World is simple to follow as well as understand and is mainly straightforward. The story line is slow in some episodes but it picks up the pace in others. The story line is also very enjoyable to follow so I am scoring it a 9/10.
Art
The Art work in Accel World is a great tolook at wheter the characters are in the real world or in the Accel World, but in my opinion the art work in the Accel World is so well done its close to being a masterpiece. So im scoring the Art a 9/10.


Sound

Ive got no complaints with the sound. The sound is very clear and the back ground music, opening scene music and even the closing scene music is well done and it fits in perfectly with this Anime series. The battle music is also done really great and doesn't overshadow the character voices at all. So for the music I will score a solid 9/10.


Characters

The characters is well drawn and the development of the main characters and even the supporting characters is pretty well done. If I have to be honest there is in some instances where the MC does cry a lot and it may get annoying to some viewers but I guess its for you to decide on that. But otherwise I am scoring the Characters a 9/10.


Enjoyment

This was a really fun and enjoyable series to watch from start to finish. I loved the battle scenes although they are not done in scale or overly flashy it was still done pretty well. So for the enjoyment I will score a 9/10.


Overall

To finish my review I will say that I will recommend this anime series to all the fans out there that are fans of SAO and similar anime genres. This series was great to watch and although I might rate SAO higher than Accel World I would still say that its worth to watch Accel World. And I do hope that a new season will get to be rolled out as soon as possible. I am scoring it a very solid 9/10.

Anime News Network gave the series a A+ rate, which is excellent. The first two arcs were really praised, on the other side, the third arc was qualified as boring and the ciritics didin't like it very much.
Personnally, I think that Accel World is a masterpiece and I have not felt bored at all during the 24 episodes that compose the series. The characters are incredibly rich and well-thought, especially the main character Arata. It's not really common for the main character of a shounen to be short and overweighted, which adds an interesting aspect to the anime because his personnality is influenced by hisphysical aspect which makes him shy and uneasy. I personnally consider this series as the brother of Sword Art Online and Log Horizon, even if the context is a little bit different. The fact that the story takes place in the real world is original in comparison to the other VRMMORPG series which often take place in a video game. The animation is really well-made and all of this is supported by an amazing soundtrack. The 9 on 10 is well deserved.

I thoroughly enjoyed this anime, despite having a couple downfalls, it brought fourth an amazing concept throughout the season, keeping me thrilled.
The biggest downfall I think would have to be the ending, the story just feels unfinished since the main objectives which were originally discussed were not achieved. 
I think the thing that kept me watching throughout this anime was how the story seemed to flow together, introducing new twists and curves and having the characters overcome and progress from them.

The main character, Haru, was a little over-exaggerated. Everyone else in the Anime was beautiful then - blegh, an 3-feet tall obese kid. It could've been put better. This anime is about a main character that is not very popular. He gets bullied and picked on and isn't good looking. Kinda cheesy in my opinion but it doesn't bother me. In this anime the main character downloads a game and it becomes his reason to keep on fighting and continuing on in life. And of course in this game he has his own unique special rare power but I'm not going to go into detail.
This anime had a lot of plot holes and to me lacks action scenes. This anime included strange fan-service that made no sense to me. *spoiler* One scene wherehis childhood friend just randomly starts stripping. To me I was like what is going on. This show also lacked detail on what kind of game this was. The point system was not explained very well and wasn't shown as much.\n\n
My overall enjoyment was alright and fair. It had some cliffhangers that made me want to watch it more. But towards the end there were like 3 episodes that were fillers to me in a sense but not sure if it was in the manga. This anime had a feel of Sword Art Online since it had a cameo of the Neuro Link. If you like the futuristic anime that have advancement in technology I would recommend it.

I enjoy watching this anime. I know that there are a lot of haters towards this anime just because of the fact that the main protagonist - Haru, is at first a short, fat and rather useless boy who is seen as pitiful and a gamer who garner sympathy from other gamers such as Kuroyukihime and et cetera. However, other than the character side of this anime, the story is pretty good (in my opinion) on how MMORPGs work in our world. We start from rock bottom with level one (noob), and work up to the top (sometimes with a high level friend who introducesus to the game) and we both share the common goal to eventually reach the top of the game. \n\n
My point is that people should not give so much hate to this anime just because the main portag is quite useless and underachieving in terms of how a portag should be XD.

Overall it is defiantly a worth while anime to watch. My only problem with this anime is how the episode were planned out. For the first 13-14 episode it was dealt with swift open and close case. But after that from 15-24 it just seemed like a snail race. Everything became extremely slow and dull compared to the first half.

Unlike other virtual rpgs, Accel World has a unique type of story plot. Some elements such as romance are similar, but it doesn't affect the story as a whole. I praise Accel World for creating such a unique environment that is set way into the future, but the story could be a lot better developed.
Story-8
What was one of the most intriguing things was that they set a little chubby boy as the main character. It's not that I hate him or anything, I just find it unusual considering how many normal looking guys are present in all other anime. What I know about the storyis that Haru obtains a game that allows him to accelerate in the accel world. If he were to lose all his points in that pvp game, the game would uninstall automatically and all memories associated with the game will be deleted. And so beings a series of adventures of leveling up and fighting other enemies. I appreciate that they create all sorts of enemies. Also, the settings/landscapes for the battle grounds are very interesting. I'll admit though that I found the concept of "accel world" hard to follow. Kuroyukihime tries to describe all about it in the first couple episodes, but I cannot seem to get my head around it. It got rather frustrating to be honest, but as the story progressed, the concept became easier to understand. Something that was very interesting was the incarnate system. Obviously, lots of anime involving action have to do with how strong their resolve is; that is, how strong their willpower is. They describe it as the incarnate system in Accel World. Also, there are 2 sides to the incarnate system. One side gives you a stronger power that is done by forming images in your head and pretending that your body is the object. However, the second side fills you with despair, anger, hate, and could potentially draw you into your own darkness and awaken as a relentless monster. When they described it in the later episodes, that was what got me into Accel World.


Art- 10

if anything, the future virtual world with the neuro-linker is amazing. You literally have a personalize computer by looking through your eyes. You can type and navigate with your hands in mid-air, literally. And the different types of enemies in Brain Burst are well thought out. I can tell Kuroyukihime was thought out very well, considering what her name means. (*Spoiler*/Trivia: Kuroyukihime means black snow princess. kuro = black, yuki = snow, and hime = princess) Although, i do not understand what a butterfly has to do with "snow" or what not, but shes definitely one of the best designed characters, not just in terms of her looks, but her personality, and character. If anything, I already fell for her the first minute I saw her in the anime. And who would've thought that she was so into games. It's like a dream girl for most guys. All i can say about the art in this anime is that it is very detailed. This is probably one of the main reasons why I've come to like this anime.


Sound-9 

I love the first ending of Accel World: unfinished. Makes a great ddr/osu music and the vocalist has a very strong voice to be able to hit the high notes. All openings and endings are great, I'm just more biased towards the first ending just because my tastes are especially into that music. The anime soundtrack itself isn't bad either. It works well with the virtual world, but to be honest it doesn't compare to Sword Art Online's OST. The battle sounds and animation in the pvp fights are pretty good. It's not too fascinating, but I've grown to like it anyway. If you get a chance, I would recommend that you listen to the openings and endings


Character-7

I'll be frank, I do not like Haruyuki. I'm sure he is strong willed and what not, but I cannot imagine a pig having such strong powers and gaining the love from a black snow princess. As I mentioned earlier, it is unusual, and unfortunately it does not work with me. He keeps saying sorry in real life for doing the littlest things, and only fights well because of his will power and friendship bonds. He can't keep his emotions down all the time either, which can cause him to go on a rampage. Ironically, I love Kuroyukihime. Her smartness and cleverness really shines out in this anime. And i'm pretty happy that she goes all the way to attract the main guy who is always being bullied and looked down on. Would i marry her? of course, if she was real. I'm glad that they look into the other minor characters with depth. That way, it gives us a better understanding as to what their relationship is to one another. It makes the story easier to understand, despite the fact that the story is not all based around them. The character development as a whole is well thought out.


Enjoyment/Overall - 9

If you are bored and are desperate to watch an anime, I would probably recommend this. If you're not into virtual games or romance involving the most beautiful girl pairing up with the most unlikely of characters, then you would probably not want to watch it. I'd recommend this because of its story plot, music, and action. Romance is all cliche in a way, other than who the lovers are, but it still fits into the story. I would love to watch accel world again, if I grow bored, but I would want to be in that future world even more. It this anime the greatest? Of course not. I have seen better, but this is an anime I do not regret watching. I understand all the criticism on this anime. Rightfully so, but somethings you just can't agree with. If this anime can affect me emotionally, I consider it good in itself.

Okay, bare with me as this will be my first ever review. First off, I would like to say that I am a huge Sword Art Online, so when I found out that the same person was involved with Accel World, I was eager about what this one was about. I can honestly say that I was just as impressed with this one as I was with SAO.
Story (8)
I found the story to be very interesting because I found myself getting involved with the world and wanting to know the reason for this world as well. However, I gotta say that when they pulled anothermove like in SAO for the second half, I was not as involved. Nevertheless, I was definitely involved with each character and each scene emotionally. So I gotta give it an 8, for there are few animes that can emotionally involve me personally (especially when there are animes like Angel Beats).


Art (10)

... the graphics were fantastic. Enough said.


Sound (9)

Character (9)

I've always loved watching animes as the characters grow and develop. With all of the characters in this one, every character, especially Silver Crow and Cyan Pile grow so much as characters as they bond after reforging their friendship. Also, I could connect to each of the character's relationships with each other as well. It was great to see each relationship, especially with Silver Crow and Black Lotus, grow and become very close. If you love action and want some good character development, this is definitely worth the time!

I love the idea behind the show, it was really exiting just exploring the risks and possiblities of the burst system. Kuroyukihime was hugely mysterious, you can't tell if you can trust her or not. Her background is particularly interesting and mysterious, enough to draw you into the show.
Unfortunately, beyond episode 12, I'm not feeling it anymore. I think the show needs to focus on building character instead of just furthering the story. We barely knew chiyu, and she's almost been removed from the show, we barely knew Fuuko (sky raker), and she's never around, to top it off, kuroyukihime is on vacation and she'spractically the star of the show. Nomi is the stupidest villain ever, but maybe it might make sense due to the incarnation systems side effects.

I would like to see more progress towards the kings side of the plot, but the show decided to be more episodic or arc like in nature, typical of the larger shonen titles. 


If you are not a shonen fan, it might still be worth watching the first 12 episodes.

(This review will contain spoilers, but only in the "Story" section of the review. For that reason, the "Story" section will remain at the end of the review. The rest of the review will be free of spoilers.
Now that we have that out of the way, let's get to the review.)
"Welcome to the Accelerated World!"
Accel World is one of two adaptions from Light Novels by Reki Kawahara. While not as popular as its counterpart, it certainly is not a bad adaption. The main weaknesses of anime are that it may lack substance at times and the characters are not all that different from most otheranimes. Although the story and characters are the show's weak points, there are enjoyable arcs, decent characters, and the fantastic art and sound of the work do more than enough to bring this series above other Action or Shounen shows. Accel World is a must watch for any fan of intense fighting scenes. Even if you aren't a fan of fighting or Mecha shows, Accel World is a series that is an enjoyable watch.



| Art: 10


The art in Accel World is extraordinary. Every scene is animated with great quality and the fighting/action scenes are no exception. Rarely does the quality of the art slip. There was obviously a large amount of the budget put into animation. The fighting scenes are a cut above the rest, with crisp effects and incredible detail. Each fight looks different from the rest, with exciting special moves and skills that are sure to please the eye. The special effects may go a bit over the top at certain times, but this makes them all the more intense, and they bring that "wow" factor. The background art isn't a disappointment either. Every episode, the backgrounds are detailed and eye catching. Never did I wonder if the animators were saving money or time with certain scenes, they were all animated beautifully.



| Sound: 9


The music in Accel World is definitely outstanding. The OPs and the EDs are, for the most part, extremely fitting, and are the perfect songs to hype up and end every episode. Even the background music and battle music is extremely well done, with each song fitting the mood and scene. When the special effects come out, so do some great sound effects that help the battles in Accel World shine. The battle music is intense and epic, while the normal background music is soothing and catchy. The only gripe I have is with the second ED, which is not that well suited to the themes in the second half of the story.



| Characters: 6


This is where the adaption falls short. Although the protagonist Haruyuki is supposed to be an overweight, self-esteem lacking character, it seems overdone, to the point where Haruyuki looks like Eric Cartman from South Park. Many watchers may want to drop the show after seeing how Haruyuki is at the beginning of the show. However, Haruyuki does show growth throughout the course of the story, becoming less and less reliant on others and more able to stand on his own. The main female character, Kuroyukihime, is one of the better characters in Accel World. She does have her own flaws in character design, being a near perfect person, and her reasoning at times are a bit far-fetched to believe. The rest of the cast each have defined roles which they fulfill, and they fulfill those roles decently, even though there are some shortcomings. The main antagonist in the second part of the story is not just a character for the purposes of being a villain. His motives are believable and the conflict between him and Haruyuki make sense most of the time. 



| Story: 7


Two sections will be for "Story", one with spoilers and one without. Scroll past the spoiler part for "Enjoyment/Overall".


Non-Spoiler:


The general story goes something like this: Haruyuki, the bullied and overweight kid is noticed by for his gaming abilities by the popular one, Kuroyukihime, who wishes for Haruyuki to join her in the Accelerated World, where people battle it for Burst Points which can be used for various purposes in real life and in the Accelerated World. Kuroyukihime wants Haruyuki's help in achieving her goals. The story is fairly clichéd, popular girl notices the outcast boy, and they become friends and work together. The story isn't really unique or different, but it is a well done story. There are some interesting moments and unique parts, but for the most part, the story is fairly generic. Rarely does the story take risks or deviate from the norm, but it does what it aims to do well. One good aspect of the anime is that there's not a lot of Deus Ex Machina. Very rarely does Haruyuki just acquire new abilities for the sake of defeating enemies. There is always growth and training, not just an unbelievable last moment intervention that comes along and saves him. Most of the Arcs in the story are decent and enjoyable, but some filler episodes ruin the flow of the anime. 



Spoiler:


Later in the story, especially during the Noumi arc, things start to get a questionable. The last arc is also a little bit off track of the main focus of the "main" story, where Kuroyukihime is looking to defeat other Level 9 Kings. The first few arcs are good, but when Noumi enters, the story falters, especially with Chiyu not explaining her motives for teaming up with Noumi, even though it could've saved her a lot of grief and fighting with Haru and Taku. For a lot of the story, people just become villains with no real change, but luckily their motives are explained after, and they're not just villains for the sole purpose of having villains in the story, but the drama created through the lack of explanations just further adds to the melodramatic nature of Accel World. It's not to say that these melodramatic moments aren't entertaining, but a lot of the time, I sat there scratching my head and asking myself why what happened in the story happened.




| Enjoyment/Overall: 8


For the most part, Accel World is enjoyable. The art and music are nice, and even the weak points of story and character are alright. Although there is a lot of melodrama, there's no denying that it doesn't create some interesting moments in the story. Accel World was enjoyable to me, and I don't typically like Mecha and large action and fighting scenes (although the story isn't really about Mecha, the fight scenes are). Accel World is a mostly enjoyable watch for Action fans and non-action fans. I recommend it if you're fine with generic animes that have some interesting aspects to it, or if you're an action fan/mecha fan. If you don't like clichéd stories or characters, then you should try a few episodes before deciding on dropping it or continuing with the series.
